text: Antrocaryon micraster is a species of flowering plant in the cashew family, Anacardiaceae. It is native to tropical Africa, where it occurs in Cameroon, the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Ivory Coast, Ghana, Nigeria, Sierra Leone, and Uganda. It grows in gaps in the forest canopy. It is harvested for its wood. ==References== Category:Vulnerable plants Category:Trees of Africa micraster Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Antrocaryon micraster
